授業目的:
This course will explore how culture
influences human mind and behaviors. The goals of the courses are to
introduce you to the field of cultural psychology and to give you hands-on
training on how to conduct research in psychology.
到達目標: Understand cross-cultural differences on various themes in cultural psychology, conduct a research project.
特記事項: 【合併】総合日本学習科目（心理Ｂ）（CIEC）/Japanese Psychology B（国際学部）
授業方法:
(a) Lectures on different themes in
cultural psychology 

(b) Group discussions and sharing

(c) Assignments and feedback writing after
class

(d) Group research project and
presentations

トピック.授業計画1:
Module 1: Introduction to cultural psychology (Week 1-2)

Module 2: Self and culture (Week 3-4)

Module 3: Methodology and group project (Week 5-6)

Module 4: Language and culture (Week 7-8)

Module 5: Emotions and culture (Week 9-10)

Module 6: Project presentations and final report (Week 11-14)
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are recommended to complete the assignments (reading research articles) and review the class-related materials (PDF handouts). They are required to attend class regularly and submit a short reflection paper (e.g., questions and/or comments about lectures and/or in-class discussions) at the end of each class.

参考書/Reference books2: Larry A. Samovar, Richard E. Porter, Edwin R. McDaniel, Carolyn S. Roy
